text.name: animal_descriptionBullFeed
text.text: Бики їдять траву, сіно та TMR.

text.name: animal_descriptionBullReproduction
text.text: Бики, які здорові та старші за 12 місяців, можуть розмножуватись.

text.name: animal_descriptionBoarReproduction
text.text: Кабани, які здорові та старші за 8 місяців, можуть розмножуватись.

text.name: animal_descriptionBoarFeed
text.text: Кабани їдять майже все. Їх можна годувати кукурудзою, пшеницею, ячменем, ріпаком, соняшником, соєю, картоплею, сорго та цукровими буряками.

text.name: animal_descriptionRamReproduction
text.text: Барани, які здорові та старші за 5 місяців, можуть розмножуватись.

text.name: animal_descriptionStallionFeed
text.text: Жеребці їдять сіно, овес і сорго.

text.name: animal_descriptionStallionReproduction
text.text: Жеребці, які здорові та старші за 36 місяців, можуть розмножуватись.

text.name: rl_settings_deathEnabled_tooltip_1
text.text: Тварини не видалятимуться через вагітність, стан здоров’я, вік або нещасні випадки

text.name: rl_settings_deathEnabled_tooltip_2
text.text: Тварини будуть видалятися через вагітність, стан здоров’я, вік або нещасні випадки

text.name: rl_settings_accidentsChance_tooltip
text.text: Змініть ймовірність видалення тварин через випадкові нещасні випадки

text.name: rl_settings_foodScale_tooltip
text.text: Change the amount of food eaten by animals

text.name: rl_settings_maxDealerAnimals_tooltip
text.text: Change the maximum number of animals the animal dealer will have in stock per animal type

text.name: rl_settings_tagColour_tooltip
text.text: Change the colour of ear tags

text.name: rl_help_monitors_1
text.text: In order to see the majority of an animal's statistics, you need to apply a monitoring tag to it, which can be done through the animal menu (where you buy and sell animals). Monitoring tags are also visually shown on the animal, on their left ear next to their ID tag.

text.name: rl_help_monitors_2
text.text: Monitoring tags will result in important information being shown to you, including health, weight, lactation, production, and straw, food and water requirements.

text.name: rl_help_monitors_3
text.text: Applying a tag to an animal will cost you a small monthly subscription based on the animal's species. If you choose to remove the tag, the tag will be removed at the start of the next month.

text.name: rl_help_pregnancy_1
text.text: Female animals all require at least 1 male animal in order to potentially become pregnant. Both animals must be of the correct age and health, and must be from the same species. Breeding between different breeds (eg: holstein cow and angus bull) is allowed.

text.name: rl_help_pregnancy_2
text.text: Inbreeding is not allowed. If a male and a female are directly related, they will not breed together.

text.name: rl_help_pregnancy_3
text.text: The chance for a female to become pregnant depends upon both her and the male's fertility. A female with higher fertility also has a significantly higher chance of producing more offspring at once.

text.name: rl_help_pregnancy_4
text.text: Once a female becomes pregnant, she will start to carry her offspring. You can view the expected date of pregnancy and the number of offspring by looking at the animal in the pen, or by clicking on her in the animal menu.

text.name: rl_help_pregnancy_5
text.text: When she reaches her due date, she will give birth to her babies. However, the newborns have a certain chance of being removed, as does the mother if the pregnancy goes badly. Newborns that are born in an overcrowded pen will be sold automatically.

text.name: rl_help_production_1
text.text: Cows of any breed will only begin to produce milk after giving birth. Once she has given birth, the cow will produce milk exponentially for 3 months, then her production will slowly drop for the next 6 months. 10 months after pregnancy, the cow will stop producing milk until her next pregnancy.

text.name: rl_help_production_2
text.text: Sheep will produce wool in warm months. In cold months, under 12C, they will not produce wool.

text.name: rl_help_production_3
text.text: Milk, wool and egg production is further affected by the animal's genetics. An animal with good production genetics will produce more, whereas animal with bad genetics wont produce much at all.

text.name: rl_help_weight_1
text.text: Animals have a certain weight that which is affected by how much they eat and drink. Every species and breed has its own average weight which affects the weight of each animal.

text.name: rl_help_weight_2
text.text: Weight increases the value of the animal, and a low weight affects its chance of being removed each month.

text.name: rl_help_genetics_1
text.text: Each animal has 4 different genetic values; metabolism, fertility, health and quality. Genetics are mixed between the mother and father and then passed down to their children.

text.name: rl_help_genetics_2
text.text: Metabolism affects the animal's ability to convert food into weight, and affects the amount it eats.

text.name: rl_help_genetics_3
text.text: Fertility affects the animal's chance of getting pregnant, or getting a female pregnant, and the number of offspring it will produce.

text.name: rl_help_genetics_4
text.text: Health affects the animal's health and its chance of being removed each month. An animal with higher health genetics will also have a longer lifespan.

text.name: rl_help_genetics_5
text.text: Quality affects the value of the animal itself, an animal with higher quality will sell for much more.

text.name: rl_help_genetics_6
text.text: Cattle, sheep and chicken also have production genetics, which affects how much milk/eggs/wool they produce.
